intro: Agonandra brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or Brazilian gooseberry, is a tropical plant native to Brazil. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, woody stem. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by fleshy, orange-colored fruits. The fruits are edible and have a slightly tart flavor, often used in local cuisine. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forested areas.
